result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Suggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Michael J Suggs in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
$100+cc+DNA, pp $50/mo beg 10-1-15, ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.
Status conference on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by  UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance only.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael J Suggs in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
BTC: Vacate Warrant  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on June 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Picked up by Waukesha Sheriff and posted. Party was released prior to being provided an Order-in date per RCSO notes.
Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSD.

Defendant Michael J Suggs not in court.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
